page.title: 12BUMBLES GREEN, 1985
page.content: AN AGRICUTERAL AREA,CRISS-CROSSED BY FOOTPATHS AND BRIDLEWAY AND BISECTED BY A FAST MAIN ROAD, BUMBLES GREEN IN THE MID-EIGHTY'S IS A PLEASANT, FRIENDLY PLACE. ONE LOCAL RESIDENT RECALLED THAT THE MAJORITY OF HOUSES IN A CUL-DE-SAC, BUILT BY THE LOCAL COUNCIL SOME 25 YEARS AGO, ARE NOW BEING OCCUPIED. ON RESALE, THE HOUSES TEND TO ATTRACT YOUNG BUYERS SO THAT THEIR FAMILIES REJUVENATE THE AREA. HE ESTIMATED ABOUT FORTY PEOPLE IN THE HAMLET WERE UNDER THE AGE OF TWENTY_FIVE. THE VILLAGE SCHOOL CLOSED BUT THE BUILDING FUNCTIONS AS A YOUTH CLUB WITH THE EX_HEADMASTER STILL LIVING IN THE ADJACENT TRIM SCHOOL HOUSE. SCHOOL CHILDREN ARE BUSSED TO LOWER NAZEING AND HODDESDON.
